definition.name: Require Labels
definition.description: Require labels to be added to a pull request before merging

inputs.name: token
inputs.description: The GitHub token to use when calling the API

inputs.name: labels
inputs.description: Comma or new line separated list of labels to match

inputs.name: mode
inputs.description: The mode of comparison to use. One of: exactly, minimum, maximum

inputs.name: count
inputs.description: The required number of labels to match

inputs.name: message
inputs.default: Label error. Requires {{errorString}} {{count}} of: {{ provided }}. Found: {{ applied }}
inputs.description: The message to log and to add to the PR (if add_comment is true). See the README for available placeholders

inputs.name: add_comment
inputs.description: Add a comment to the PR if required labels are missing

inputs.name: exit_type
inputs.description: The exit type of the action. One of: failure, success

inputs.name: use_regex
inputs.description: Evaluate the values in `labels` as regular expressions

outputs.name: labels
outputs.description: The labels that were matched as a comma separated string

evidence.reasoning: This action ensures that specific labels are required on pull requests, which helps maintain code quality and organization. It also provides feedback on the status of the labels, which can be considered a form of notification.
